titleStmt.title: The constancy of the people called Quakers. In their testimony against popery, sincerely asserted, in opposition to a perverss [sic] lybel, falsly stiled, A looking-Glass for the Quakers, (in two collumns) sallaciously mis-representing them: / Humbly offered to publick and impartial view.

notesStmt.note: At end: "London, the 30th of the [ ] Month, called May 1689. Written in behalf of the Peaceable People of God called, Quakers, by some of them."
Reproduction of original in: Friends' Library (London, England).
